1479.20.text: You don't need to answer that.

1480.80.text: Would you like to go first or second?

1482.56.text:
- Go first. 
- Yeah. 
- I think we'll go first, Jeremy.

1488.80.text: Here we go then. Good luck.

1490.84.text: How many years are there in a triennium?

1496.76.text: How many years are there in a triennium?

1499.80.text: You'd assume that if it's a millennium...

1501.88.text:
- A millennium is 1,000, isn't it? 
- A triennium is three. 
- 3,000.

1505.36.text: I'm happy to go with that as well.

1510.32.text: 3,000. I think that might be a tri-millennium.

1513.24.text: How do we get to...? It's three. It's three.

1519.00.text: Yeah, I was going to say,

1543.16.text: So they are ahead. It's not over.

1545.92.text: Who won the Best British Album and Best British Male Solo Artist

1554.32.text: Who won the Best British Album

1556.76.text: and Best British Male Solo Artist awards at the 2015 Brits?

1564.60.text:
- I'm pretty sure it was Sam Smith. 
- I'm pretty sure it was Sam Smith.

1567.44.text: I don't think it was George Ezra.

1572.04.text: I know there was news of him clearing up, wasn't there?

1574.64.text:
- Yeah. 
- Shall we go for that?

1576.36.text: Yeah, I think we'll go for Sam Smith.

1578.28.text: Yeah, we'll go with Sam Smith.

1582.56.text: I know why you said that, because I heard him getting...

1584.92.text: MARK SIGHS What was it that he got?

1586.48.text:
- Was it the Grammys? 
- Well, four Grammys.

1588.36.text: He got a load of Grammys.

1589.72.text: He got a couple of Brits as well, but he got something like

1592.60.text: Record of the Year and he also got

1595.84.text: Yeah, he did. But he didn't get this.

1597.48.text: He didn't get British Album and Male Solo Artist.

1600.80.text: That was Ed Sheeran. MARK SIGHS

1604.84.text: And, Eggheads, that means you can

1609.36.text: The Serpentine is a lake in which of these London parks?

1619.20.text: in which of these London parks?

1621.72.text:
- Hyde Park. 
- It's Hyde Park, yeah? 
- Hyde Park, yep.

1624.48.text: I think it was used in the Olympics for some long-distance swimming.

1629.80.text: Yes, I cycle past it every day,

1633.24.text: Hyde Park is the correct answer.

1634.76.text: We say... Congratulations, Eggheads, you have won!

1645.60.text:
- I'm sorry that was so quick. 
- Not a great final round.

1648.28.text: Well, it can happen. It really can. And the triennium thing...

1654.84.text: I think it probably would be something like tri-millennium.

1658.68.text: I think we probably rushed that one a bit as well.

1660.72.text:
- Yeah, cos it looked like it was so obvious. 
- Yeah.

1663.12.text:
- I hope you've enjoyed coming. 
- Yeah, no, it's been a great day.

1666.44.text: Brilliant team. We say commiserations to Quiz Park Raisins.

1669.96.text: Dave, you're forgiven them now for their comments

1672.20.text:
- about Manchester United? 
- No. 
- THEY LAUGH

1675.12.text: The Eggheads have done what comes naturally to them.

1679.20.text: So it means that you won't be going home with the £8,000.

1681.96.text: The money, therefore, rolls over to our next show.

1684.84.text: Eggheads, very well done. Who will beat you?

1686.96.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1689.80.text: have the brains to defeat the Eggheads.

1692.08.text: £9,000 says they don't. Till then, goodbye.
